title: Bi-Weekly Gaming Discussion Thread
selftext:
What are you playing, r/India? Let us use this thread to discuss any games you're playing, have played or are going to play. (Mobile and board games included!)

What game are you looking forward to? Are you a developer? Show us your wares!

Please don't just list the names of games, make sure to write a word or two about them as well.

Check out r/IndianGaming! They are an active community and also host a few co-op sessions.

**Gaming Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Gaming+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/xagdqefyv8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=f975f1c3093a3d9598a1da39854b03d1250bd55d
comments: Getting into Kerbal Space Program. Trying to land a ship on moon.

I am a boomer getting back to gaming after dabbling with DotA.

I wanted to check games in the lines of AoE and AoM. I also liked [Commandos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commandos_(series). 

I tried Starcraft, but I was not enamoured by it. May be the strategy + historical (non-fictional) aspect of AoE, AoM and Commandos that clicked with me. Or it was something *je ne sais quoi*

Are there any games similar to the aforementioned that I can try on my Lenovo Ideapad 330 i5 8th Gen laptop?

I am done with diablo 4 season 1 already cant take anymore of lvling up druid lol.
Now I am waiting for Baldur Gates 3 full release on 3rd August. 
GG
Finished Final Fantasy VII Remake today, good game but felt it was bit stretched in the end.
Not yet. I see it is on steam. I will give it a try. Thanks
